actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights

official_title: Declaring that the amendment to the Constitution of the United States, prohibiting the altering of compensation of Senators and Representatives without an intervening election of Representatives, is valid to all intents and purposes as part of the Constitution of the United States.

summary.text: Declares the proposed amendment to the Constitution that prohibits the alteration of the compensation of Members of Congress until an election of Representatives has intervened to be valid and a part of the Constitution.

titles.title: Declaring that the amendment to the Constitution of the United States, prohibiting the altering of compensation of Senators and Representatives without an intervening election of Representatives, is valid to all intents and purposes as part of the Constitution of the United States.
